name: M42/M43
description: The famous Orion Nebula is one of the brightest nebulae in the sky, readily visible to the naked eye as a 'fuzzy star' in Orion's sword. It is spectacular in convention full spectrum images, but is so bright that it also reveals interesting structure in multiple isolated wavelengths. This image presents different combinations of of light emitted by hydrogen, oxygen, and sulfur. Use the 'specials' tool to see each combination, as well as each channel in isolation.

special.name: Hubble
special.description: Narrow Band Rendered in Hubble Palette
